text: I have a problem with the resize_image_url function not working if I give it sizes larger than 800px either way. It then returns the full original image. Do anyone else have this problem? I have the same problem when entering URL parameters height and with manually too, so it seems server related
<@U6TBZ66FN> and <@U6GNQ7JBU> curious for your thoughts on this as i know we get the leverage browser caching and defer one on our clients when we run them through these tools

I see many of your JS/CSS are from file manager. If they are from the design manager, they will be minified automatically if possible. And many of those are added at the footer, that is good for JS. If you add those CSS in the `<head>` they can potentially be combined as one CSS file.
awesome thank you. so basically move CSS to head and try to combine them together?
should I attempt to minify some files manually as well?
If you leave those file in the FileManager, you should minify yourself. If the reference them from the DesignManager, it will be minified for you.
I have noticed your page has a re-flow â€” that is it shows the menu and other stuff, then after the css in the footer is loaded, it need to apply those css rules to update the layout.
how would we fix that issue?
